title: Sylas should have his heal looked at
body:
Currently on the PBE:
http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/current-pbe-balance-changes.html
Chain Lash (Q)
First hit damage AP ratio increased from 60% to 70%

Kingslayer (W)
damage increased from 60/90/120/150/180 to 60/100/40/180/220
healing increased from 50/80/110/140/170 to 60/80/100/120/140
heal AP ratio increased from 35% to 45%

After playing against him some more it looks to me like his heal might be a little too powerful.  For reference, Vlad's targeted heal can heal him for 20 / 25 / 30 / 35 / 40 (+ 35% AP).  At rank 9, Vlad can heal for about the same as Sylas does with Crimson Rush.  This doesn't take into account the fact that Sylas has his heal doubled when below 40% health which means he currently can get a 340 + 70%AP heal at rank 9 and at rank 1 it's 100 + 60%AP.  Of course you can't directly compare the two because Vlad is ranged, has an easier time procing it, etc.  However, considering Sylas' heal is also targeted with a hefty amount of damage as well as the fact that he doesn't really have all that much trouble getting to a target (especially in the early game) it is a pretty insane heal.

His heal can make him insanely hard to push out of lane because of how easy it is to proc and makes his all ins super crazy as well.  Doesn't really feel fun playing against someone who can win a trade or all in because he used his targeted heal.  I would consider lowering the base by a lot more and increasing the AP Ratio more to compensate.  Another option could be to make the threshold for the double heal a lot lower (20 - 30%).  He's already in a solid spot for a new champion so I'm kinda confused as to why he is even being buffed in the first place tbh.

I mean, in fairness, Vlad also get's his natural HP growth with AP along with his sustain, along with his Ult's HP gain, along with intargetibility with his pool. Sylas has a big shield, and a big heal. I've not a problem with his heal in lane, so much as I do with his heal late game, or in team fights, but even then, somebody has aught to have Grevious Wounds by that point.

That's why I said you can't directly compare them both.  I'm just pointing out that his heal is actually pretty big compared to a lot of other heals in this game.  Especially when you consider that it is also targeted.

I guess it begs the question, is this what is required to have an AP Bruiser, whose damage is much more drawn out? Sylas doesn't have the burst potential a lot of other bruisers do, unless fed, nor does he have as accessible CC. His survivability in a teamfight is purely reliant on his ability to heal. Makes me wonder what we could do with Diana if we took away some of her burst in exchange for a heal on her Pull-in, maybe have some fun and make it heal more when she pulls in more people.

The bigger problem is that there isn't really any good AP Bruiser items in the game so they have to give AP Bruisers really good defensive mechanics that can be unfun to play against and sometimes overpowered.  I would rather Sylas get his heal nerfed and compensated in some different way so he's not as frustrating to play against.  They could still give him the ability to do a lot of healing in teamfights and later stages of the game.  The only problem I'm really having atm is his early - early mid game healing.

This whole thing is really only part of a larger problem, but the smaller things can be given band aid fixes that sorta help the problem for the time being.

Personally, I've had a worst time dealing with his CDs than his healing in the early game, but that's just me. That said, having a bruiser item implemented doesn't address the times in laning phase in which the healing might be a problem, and then we ask the question again, does he need that healing to get along fair in Lane? Normal bruisers have the ability to buy lifesteal, and while Sylas can go gunblade, it's not the best rush item when he desperately needs to bulk up. 

I think at this point it is firmly a design conflict, or at least an foreign place for us. Sylas is the first AP Melee bruiser that hasn't just felt like a Burst mage. Even when Fed, his design spreads out his damage so far that you're still given a fair chance. A familiar case with Riot releasing Melee champions, a constant debate on "Do they need it and when do they."
